thread.title: China Toy Factory Workers Protest Over Unpaid Wages
thread.title_full: China Toy Factory Workers Protest Over Unpaid Wages

title: China Toy Factory Workers Protest Over Unpaid Wages
text:
Asian Business News China Toy Factory Workers Protest Over Unpaid Wages Labor unrest tied to the closure of a Mattel supplier is the latest stemming from a series of shutdowns across the country By Laurie.Burkitt@wsj.com Updated Aug. 8, 2015 5:27 a.m. ET 
BEIJING—The closure of a Chinese toy factory that supplies Mattel Inc. sparked protests this past week involving hundreds of workers demanding unpaid wages, the latest in a spate of labor unrest sparked by plant shutdowns across China’s manufacturing sector. 
Workers at Ever Force Toys & Electronics Co., a Hong Kong-owned toy maker in the southern industrial city of Dongguan, said they started gathering Tuesday to demand three... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
